com.team1389.util

Class RangeUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.team1389.util.RangeUtil

  • public class RangeUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    this class offers a set of operations for a value in a range
    Author:
    amind

    • Method Detail

      • map

        public static double map(double x,
                         double in_min,
                         double in_max,
                         double out_min,
                         double out_max)
        Re-maps a number from one range to another. *

        Does not constrain values to within the range, because out-of-range values are sometimes intended and useful. The constrain() function may be used either before or after this function, if limits to the ranges are desired.

        Note that the "lower bounds" of either range may be larger or smaller than the "upper bounds" so the map() function may be used to reverse a range of numbers, for example 

          y = map(x, 1, 50, 50, 1);

        The function also handles negative numbers well, so that this example 

          y = map(x, 1, 50, 50, -100);
        is also valid and works well.
        Parameters:
        x - the value in the original range, Does not constrain values to within the range, because out-of-range values are sometimes intended and useful.
        in_min - the lower limit of the original range
        in_max - the upper limit of the original range
        out_min - the lower limit of the mapped range
        out_max - the upper limit of the mapped range
        Returns:
        the mapped version of x

      • limit

        public static double limit(double v,
                           double min,
                           double max)
        Constrains a value to be between [min and max]
        Parameters:
        v - the original value
        max - the maximum value of v ;
        min - the minimum value of v ;
        Returns:
        the constrained version of v

      • applyDeadband

        public static double applyDeadband(double val,
                                   double deadband)
        Truncates any val close to zero, creating a "dead zone" around zero.
        Parameters:
        val - the value to test; if it is in the dead zone, it will be set to zero.
        deadband - the minimum distance from zero to avoid truncating
        Returns:
        the truncated version of val

      • wrapValue

        public static double wrapValue(double val,
                               double min,
                               double max)
        wraps a value to be within the given range (when a value leaves the range, it enters the range from the other side)
        Parameters:
        val - the value to wrap
        min - the minimum of the wrapping range
        max - the maximum of the wrapping range
        Returns:
        the wrapped value
